name: Front Plate Raise
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing a stable bench or flat surface.
2. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell in each hand, palms facing towards your body and arms at your sides.

3. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine, keeping your back straight and abs tight.

4. Lift the weights forward, keeping your elbows slightly bent (around 15-20 degrees), until the plates are at shoulder height or just below it.

5. Squeeze your shoulders together as you lift, focusing on targeting your deltoids.

6. Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position without swinging them. Keep control throughout the lowering phase and avoid letting the weights touch each other or your body.

7. Aim for 8-12 repetitions in a set, keeping consistent form and focus throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Front Plate Raise is an upper body exercise that primarily works the shoulders and promotes strength development.
